intro: Ophiorrhiza ripicola, commonly known as the rock orchid, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous plant typically found growing in rocky or coastal areas. The plant has slender, often hairy stems and small, clustered leaves that are usually less than 2 centimeters in length. Its flowers are simple and usually white or pale pink, with four petals and two sepals. Ophiorrhiza ripicola is adapted to grow in nutrient-poor soils and is often found in disturbed or coastal habitats.
